attributes.action: Interject in the case of Gary Mckinnon.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Gary Mckinnon suffers from an Autistic Spectrum Disorder which played both a part in his actions and his ability to cope with extradition, trial and potentially jail.

We, the undersigned, believe that any trial Gary may face should be held in the UK under English law.

Above all we believe that extradition would pose a dire threat to the long term health of Gary and should be blocked at any cost.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions on individual legal cases. Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.

In a statement today, the Home Secretary has said: "It would be illegal for me to stop the extradition of Gary McKinnon, which the Court ruling has made clear."
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
